review:
I will admit, it's better than I thought it would be. Granted, given the reviews, I thought it would be completely unplayable. I played the whole way through and the game does have potential and there were a few cool concepts included. However, it is completely unpolished and feels unfinished. Several towns on the world map are just there for decoration. Also, the writing and story seems bare bones. There are also errors in grammar and spelling, along with some minor graphics issues and passability errors on the maps. Enemy balance is just barely tolerable. The most frustrating thing about this game is that the vast majority of its issues could have been avoided with just a little playtesting and draft editing. This could have been a decent RPG maker game if the effort had actually been put in. As it is it's kind of a mess. 

Now at least it's not bad enough to be painful to play through. It's just very bland and unpolished. Extremely mediocre. Feels like a first draft of a game that never got past that. I can't in good conscience recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796851430', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 3719, 'playtime_forever': 6361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6361, 'last_played': 1650167623}
review:
《Drayt Empire》以建设和管理帝国为核心玩法，旨在让玩家体验成为帝国统治者的乐趣。然而，在我深入体验这款游戏后，却感到失望和不满。

首先从游戏的核心玩法来看显得单调乏味。建设和管理帝国的概念听起来很有吸引力，但游戏在实际操作中却缺乏足够的深度和策略性。玩家在进行城市建设、资源管理和外交关系等方面时，感到缺乏挑战性和趣味性。游戏的决策和选择对游戏进程的影响有限，使得玩家难以真正感受到作为帝国统治者的权力和成就感。

其次游戏的画面和音效表现也令人失望。虽然游戏采用了较为现代的图形引擎，但整体画面效果却显得粗糙和不够精致。城市建筑和角色的设计缺乏足够的细节和质感，使得整个游戏世界显得缺乏真实感和代入感。音效方面，游戏的背景音乐和音效效果也显得平淡无奇，无法为玩家营造出沉浸式的游戏体验。

此外游戏的剧情和角色塑造同样令人感到薄弱。游戏试图通过一些故事情节和角色互动来丰富玩家的游戏体验，但实际效果却不尽如人意。剧情发展平淡无奇，缺乏足够的吸引力和情感共鸣。角色设定也显得模糊和缺乏个性，玩家很难对他们产生深厚的情感联系。这使得玩家在游玩过程中难以完全沉浸于游戏的故事和情感之中。

最后从游戏的稳定性和优化方面来看，也存在一些问题。我在游玩过程中遇到了多次卡顿和崩溃的情况，这严重影响了我的游戏体验。同时游戏的加载时间也相对较长，使得玩家在进入游戏前需要等待较长的时间。

综上所述，这款游戏在核心玩法、画面音效、剧情角色以及稳定性和优化等方面都未能达到玩家的期待。如果你对建设和管理类游戏有较高的要求，或者希望寻找一款更具深度和趣味性的游戏，那么这款游戏可能并不适合你。希望开发者能够在未来的作品中认真倾听玩家的反馈，不断改进和完善游戏的设计，为玩家带来更好的游戏体验。

author: {'steamid': '76561198291323774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1669518538}
review:
While this game does have some potential, let me start off by saying that this is the most confusing game I've ever played. The main quest in this game revolves around 2 boys (or maybe they're men? Can't really tell) attempting to search for a city lost to a nuclear disaster. This is all well and good, but the game flips you over backwards and sideways for oftentimes meaningless diversions. Hike halfway across the globe to find an orb, catch a chicken that moves 3 times faster than your character, you know the deal. Sometimes following the story and directions becomes impossible due to poor directions and borderline useless dialogue.

Speaking of dialogue, I would be tough pressed to find a sentence in this game without a grammatical error. Now I'm not asking for perfection or anything, but a simple spell check couldn't hurt. This sort of plays into the directions aspect as well, as when an NPC correlating to the main quest tells me to (and I quote) "go to the of port westsouth", it can be hard to know what the answer is. A little bit of a spell check and maybe this game could be finishable.

Lastly, we have the characters. Due to the confusing nature of the story, I wasn't able to make it too far. Thus, I had only Ronarke, Drayt and Natalie in my party. Thus, Ernest, Karl and whoever else are currently unobtainable, at least by a normal player's standards. Equipment and stats were seemingly okay, but then we have skills. There is a "learn skills" option that effectively does absolutely nothing. Drayt starts learning skills randomly after a certain point, with no rhyme or reason, and with no correlation to his class or (nonexistent) character arc. Essentially, it's a dumpster fire, and the stats system (coupled with the maybe 15 different monsters this game has) pretty much locks it on super easy mode. Seekers of any challenge whatsoever need not apply.

All in all, I do like the story's potential, the characters aren't bad conceptually, but in it's current state I cannot recommend wasting any sort of time on this game. I hope, for future updates, that this game can possibly rise in quality, but until then it is quite possibly the worst RPG maker game available on Steam.

review:
Описание:
Drayt Empire. Играем за простого паренька, который живет с мамой и решает отправиться в путешествие. 
Стандартная история 90% игр на RPG Maker. 
Ну да ладно, иногда получаются интересные проекты. 
Но это не тот случай... 
Я перечислю сначала то на, что можно закрыть глаза, а потом причины почему забросил прохождение.
Я готов закрыть глаза на минусы игры:
*Стандартные ассеты и музыку.
*Захламленное меню.
*Шаблонные и сделанные под копирку здания.
*То, что нельзя взаимодействовать с предметами и 90% нпц и зданий не несут в себе ничего кроме элемента декора...

Но я не готов закрывать глаза на:
*Два квеста, которые повторяются иногда по несколько раз за один город. 
Убей врагов и найди монеты.
*Игра загружена огромной кучей скриптов с форума рпг. 
Прямо переполнена! Мини-игры, цвета и прочее. Разработчик видимо не в курсе, что это дает лаги... 
На некоторых локациях просто невозможно передвигаться.
*Смерть от отравление без начальной доступности к антидотам!
*Нападение монстров каждые 2-3 шага, а ведь их еще и убивать надо, чтобы гриндить бесконечные мази навсегда повышающие хп и защиту.
*Бесконечное количество багов.

Я честно дал игре шанс и хотел дойти до конца. 
Но когда я в 4 городе подряд искал кучку монет, я уже не выдержал... 
Халтура!

Моя оценка: 3/10

review:
I like RPG games and thought this might be interesting. An hour or two into the game, I left it, came back the next day, and couldn't remember the quest I was on. There was no quest log system to guide me, and talking to the NPCs also didn't provide help. I was stuck, couldn't progress, and lost interest.

To be fair, I don't think the old Final Fantasy games had a quest log system either, but for some reason, it was easy to remember what I needed to do there.

So for this game, I would definitely recommend:
1. that the dev introduce a quest log, or
2. that you, the player, keep notes.

review:
Drayt Empire ist an Peinlichkeit kaum zu übertreffen!

Schon anfangs trifft man alle 10 Meter auf unpassende, äußerst deplatzierte und hässliche Monster die nur als Kampffutter dienen. Mehr nicht. Spannend sind diese Kämpfe überhaupt nicht, denn es kommt auch öfter vor, dass über 5 bis 10 Runden gar kein Schaden ausgeteilt wird. Zudem sind die Kämpfe auch besonders unfair, da die Monster den Spieler mit Statuseffekten versehen können und man keine Gegenmittel hat. Sehr bedacht.

Schaut man sich dann das Map-Design mal an, kann man erkennen, dass Türen nicht vorhanden sind. War das etwa zu anspruchsvoll für den Entwickler? Übersieht man das, wird man mit Sicherheit nicht die Labyrinthe übersehen, die in jedem RPG-Maker-Cashgrab vorhanden sind. Ich kann daher bis heute nicht nachvollziehen, was daran bitte gut sein soll?
Drayt Empire ist eine weitere Demütigung und sollte auf keinen Fall gekauft werden.

Wer spielt das denn bitte freiwillig?

review:

review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Треш jrpg. Играем за простого паренька, который живет с мамой и решает отправиться в путешествие. Стандартная история 90% игр на RPG Maker. Ну да ладно иногда получаются интересные проекты. Но это не тот случай... Я перечислю сначала на, что можно закрыть глаза, а потом причины почему забросил прохождение.
Я готов закрыть глаза на минусы игры:
*Стандартные ассеты и музыку.
*Захламленное меню.
*Шаблонные и сделанные под копирку здания.
*То, что нельзя взаимодействовать с предметами и 90% нпц и зданий не несут в себе ничего кроме элемента декора...

Но я не готов закрывать глаза на:
*Два квеста, которые повторяются иногда по несколько раз за один город. Убей врагов и найди монеты.
*Игра загружена огромной кучей скриптов с форума рпг. Прямо переполнена! Мини-игры, цвета и прочее. Разработчик видимо не в курсе, что это дает лаги... На некоторых локациях просто невозможно передвигаться.
*Смерть от отравление без начальной доступности к антидотам!
*Нападение монстров каждые 2-3 шага, а ведь их еще и убивать надо, чтобы гриндить бесконечные мази насегда повышеющие хп и защиту.
*Бесконечное количество багов.

Я честно дал игре шанс и хотел дойти до конца. Но когда я в 4 городе подряд искал кучку монет, я уже не выдержал... Халтура!

[h1]Оценка: 3/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

review:
A terrible game that you should avoid at all costs (even if you get it for free). This has the worst random encounter rate I've ever experienced, a nonexistent story line, and grammar that makes the old NES port translators seem like English Language PhD candidates. Complete with characters that miss more attacks than they connect and nonstop random encounters that only serve to pad the game's length, and let's not forget the fact that half of the locations on the world map are never accessible during game play.

This is a completely unfinished and unprofessional product. Sure the pixelated style could make one nostalgic for the glory days of RPG's, but I can find no redeeming quality that would make me ever recommend this game to anyone on any occasion. Terrible. Utterly terrible.

review:
Oh. My. God - what a sh*tty game.

The only and unique pro: the game is so f*cking cheap that you won't be sorry for buying it.

The cons: So, I started playing, and I really love this pixel graphic, gives me nostalgia, and of course, I love the RPG theme, so ok, I started playing. In the first city I remember to have accepted 4 or 5 same quests, from the same NPC, but in different buildings, so ok, I continue it, but what is the quest? THERE IS NO QUEST LIST, how can a dev make a RPG game without a quest list? So I continue playing, f*ck the quest list. I leave the city and enter a cave, and the game just loses it: the dev COMPLETELY RIPPED OFF EVERY SINGLE POKEMON GAME. You give like 3 steps and a monster jumps in your away and you HAVE to battle it, you can't escape. So ok, I battle all monsters that come in my away (Drayt is really strong, and the protagonist is really weak) and leave the cave, and reach the other city. More of the same quest (defeat a monster outside the town) by THE SAME F*CKING NPC. And then I proceed to do the exact same thing for another half hour or so. And then I reach the castle, talk to EVERY single NPC and that's it, there's nothing to do anymore, and then I got tired of the EXACT SAME THING OVER AND OVER AGAIN and left the game (I played the game for 2 hours, because I explore everything in order to loot, the other 4 hours is Indling).

And I'm not even gonna start on the chests: there's like 10 in every city, chests in RPG games are supposed to me rewarded at the end of a quest or a dungeon, but not on this game.

So please, STOP MAKING THIS FUCKING RPGMAKER TRASH, just stop.

review:
When I started the game in November 2016 it had many flaws of which most still exist.

- If you miss anything being said you better have a saved before of you will have to talk to people and hope you find the right one.
- Some HORRIBLE typos... (someone in another review mentioned "I'm a minor" instead of miner)

I missed something right after starting Chapter 2 and stumbled around in confusion and pain until I didn't have the mood to continue and so I stopped playing the game. One achievement was bugged so and after the fix I continued playing and by chance I found the right person I missed earlier and after some time I was able to defeat the game. But the final achievement didn't trigger so I went on a mission finding what was wrong and with the help of DrIch of the dev team I was able to find some things out. I started all over again and atm everything works fine in the game. The errors mentioned above do still exist but the game is inexpensive enough to turn a blind eye to those minors ;)

After all that being said if you do like the old school games on Game Boy like Zelda, etc then go on and buy this game. I did like the music and the story is okay, too. But be prepared to do not do all quests if you want that last achievement as it only triggersfor doing half of them right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097955426', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1489364878}
review:
Eu sou uma grande fã de jogos feitos no RPG Maker, então decidi dar uma chance para "Drayt Empire", mesmo tendo lido algumas críticas negativas.

Começei o jogo, ok, fiz uma quest de pegar maçãs e depois fui falar com outro personagem jogável. Até aí tudo bem, cheguei na parte que você sai do mapa, consegui sair, mas bugou no mapa menor. Dei uma segunda chance, comecei o jogo tudo de novo, fiz as mesmas coisas e na parte para sair do mapa da cidade, não saia de jeito nenhum, os dois ficavam empacados. Começei o jogo de novo, pela terceira vez, e NADA de sair do mapa da cidade, os personagens ficam parados e não saem da cidade por nada. Falei com todos os NPCs possíveis e nada.

Na quarta vez, eu finalmente consegui sair do mapa, a cada dois passos aparecia um monstro do nada pra lutar, não dava pra andar direito. Tem vários NPCs, mas a maioria tem a MESMA quest para você fazer e quando você conversa com ele de novo, a mesma quest tá lá para ser aceita. Eu desisti. Nenhum envolvido na criação do jogo testou ele antes de por na Steam? 

Não recomendo essa porcaria para ninguém.

Nota Final: 1/10

review:
The game has been updated and patched, sometime in March I think. Most of the annoying things seems to have been fixed but there are still aspects that could really do with a proper Beta-player (or several). It's once again playable, though I'm not changing my "thumb down" for this game. For a long while it was bugged right from the start (see my original review) but the various triggers seem to trigger now and I'm pretty sure there are no broken achievements.

The good things mentioned in my original review are still good. But! You still don't have any idea what to do since there are very few clues in where to go and who to talk to (there's a video walkthrough for an earlier version without an ending but at least it's somewhat helpful). It's very easy to miss triggers that "open" up more of the game because at least one of them need you to walk over a certain area and another to read a sign. Yeah. 

-----------

ORIGINAL REVIEW

This is a crappy, broken and most likely abandoned game. Unfortunately. I started playing it in July 2016 but took a break from it (luckily after getting the chicken achievement) because it was very clearly an Early Access game, despite being sold/advertised as a full/finished game. I wanted to wait until they had added features like NPCs, items, chests, quests etc. You know, normal things you should be able to experience in a game. I was also annoyed with all the design flaws like walking on trees and being blocked by grass. Some things are now fixed, but most are still badly designed with blocked off areas and invisible doors.

Good thing: they've added NPCs, items, chests, quests and fixed some bad designs/layouts and unkillable monsters.
Bad thing: they broke the game with the (probably) latest update/fix sometime late last year. 

If you're a new player starting a new game, you won't be leaving the first village because a main quest trigger won't be triggered in the first chapter's very beginning. Game Over. Result: 2/8 achievements.
If you're like me, continuing a saved game from outside the first village in the first chapter will take you all the way to the second chapter's very beginning where, once again, a main quest trigger won't be triggered. Game Over. Result: 6/8 achievements or, if you got the Chicken Rancher achievement before the "fix", 7/8 achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068461340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1519351686}
review:
A nice, fun, and silly little JRPG, Drayt Empire has enough colour, mindless combat, and a poppy soundtrack to keep you occupied for a few hours. 

Firstly, while fun, it seems fairly unfinished - sounds appeared to be missing here and there, and there were enough spelling and grammatical errors to give anyone a headache. Second, most of the content seems to be taken from RPGMaker "as is" which is fairly disappointing. There is apparently an update to the game that will amend this so I'll consider changing my recommendation on the game when that day comes. Finally, the story is fairly threadbare - JRPG after all, so crystals, demons, and saving the world. 

This is one of those times that I wish that Steam had a mid-way point between pass and fail. Sure it's probably good for some warm and familiar fun, and it's flaws can mostly be overlooked if you're aware of them going in.

[b]Pros[/b]
+Fun and silly JRPG-inspired game
+Cheap

[b]Cons[/b]
+Odd and unevenly told story
+Like really odd - it just incorporates other JRPG tropes in a weird manner
+Unsure if done ironically
+Game doesn't appear fully finished - please hire a proof-reader!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083702738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1469390684}
review:
I like RPGs a lot so this was a no brainer for me for its meager price on sale.  This RPG is decent enough but I can't recommend this game until it gets updated.  I think the combat system is fine but I wish the game would tell you the hit points of the enemy during combat.  Not knowing what you're up against makes it difficult to plan moves and strategies during combat.  I was fighting the Lamia in an abandoned town and I fought it for at least 5-10 minutes before it died.  I kept wondering whether it would be killed or not during every turn.  This doesn't bother me too much but it would be nice if added in.

I also would like their to be a quest log or notes so you can remember what you have to do when you leave the game.  If there is one, I can't find it in the menu.  And you can't go back to the person who gave you the directions to read the quest again.  While this makes sense in terms of dialogue, it makes it difficult to complete the game.  I would just like a little bit more direction throughout the game and for the story to be more fleshed out than it is now.

I saw that Sir Dan said that this was an Indonesian RPG so I understand why there are spelling and grammatical errors in the dialogue.  I would like to see some attempts to fix some errors here and there to make the game a little more appealing.

Overall, I wouldn't say it is a bad game, but I don't think it has reached its potential.  I think if they fixed these things or just released some updates to flesh out the game more I could easily recommend it.

I also appreciate that the developers are responding to feedback regularly and taking the time to fix errors and bugs. Therefore, I would not define the developers as "lazy".  I can forsee myself recommending the game in the future as long as they keep updating.

Edit: In light of recent updates and continual support of the game by the developer, I have chosen to recommend this game as it continues to grow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203340085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1468978948}
review:
Edit: I mistook the developer with their shady publisher. I apologize for this and take full responsibility for my mistake. I have not edited the review yet as I still cannot be 100% sure that RPG video and Sir Dan are not the same person. I also apologize for being a little too extreme. Anyway, here's the review.

Edit: Ok, pretty sure now. I have edited the review to give feedback. Again, apologies for my mistake and the best of luck to the real developer with updates.

Every once in a while you see a game on steam that just makes you go ''why''. WHY. This, for me, is that game.
You are thrown into the game without a single idea of what is going on. Apparently you were with your friend Dyart out fishing so your mum can make ''fish pie''(can anyone please tell me if that's even a real thing?). After that the game is a series of random events happening without a single explanation. Your mum asks you to pick apples. When you do find the apples though, they are not even apples. It's a box of corn. A BOX OF CORN. And somehow the game expects you to figure out that's apples and take it to your mum? And even this early, you can find a game breaking bug. If you interact with your mother in the wrong direction your character will become unable to move and you will have to restart the game. The dialogue is so poorly written to the point where it has zero punctation and has a lot of typos.

There is only one good thing I can say about the game: I like the menu. The game tells you it has minigames, which sounds cool but then you realize they are just a bunch of pre-made scripts without the slightest bit of modification. The story is pretty much unexistant, and everything is just random. There are random encounters all around the place and they are always just the same (default rpg maker) enemies, with the exception of the ''slime'' monster. But it's not even a slime. It's a giant furry animal, not a fucking slime. You don't have any skills when you start the game, so the monsters are just defeated by mashing spacebar and using an item when needed. There is one town in the game which is another sample map, but using a pre-bought resource pack for rpg maker. Now, I have nothing against pre-bought packs. In fact, the one the developer used is a really nice looking pack. But the tiles are used SO INCORRECTLY and DON'T FIT WITH THE REST OF THE GAME'S STYLE, which kinda ruins it. You are given random quests without any explanation to why you should do them and the game is just so random that it stopped being funny after the first minute of gameplay. And in the same town, it is possible to walk over trees and fences.

The game definetly needs to be updated before being properly playable, but in it's current state it's not exactly worth buying. I have spoken with the developer, and apparently they are planning to update the game to fix a lot of the bugs, so I'll be re-reviewing the game when that happens.

10/10
